title: How to Prepare Yemeni Style Fava Beans

steps.headline: Grab the necessary kitchen utensils.
steps.description: See Ingredients section above and Things You'll Need below for reference.

steps.headline: Add the oil, onions, and chili pepper to the pot.
Cook for 2-3 minutes on medium heat while stirring.
Add the garlic once the onions start to turn a brownish color.
steps.description: Saute the ingredients for another 2-3 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the tomatoes and/or tomato sauce.
steps.description: If the tomatoes aren't that ripe, then they will provide a bland flavor. To ensure vibrant flavor, add 2/3 a can of tomato sauce on top of the tomatoes.

steps.headline: Sprinkle in the seasoning.
steps.description: This seasoning of coriander, cumin, and black pepper along with the chili pepper will create a strong spicy flavor which is typical of many middle eastern dishes.

steps.headline: Mash up the fava beans.
steps.description: In a separate container, mash up the fava beans either using a mixer or the bottom of the can. Add the beans to the pot and stir.

steps.headline: Dump in 1 cup of water and a tsp of salt and mix.
steps.description: The water added makes the dish more like a salsa than your traditional bean dip.

steps.headline: Cook for about 20 minutes.
steps.description: As you're cooking, continuously stir. You will know the dish is about finished when it begins to boil. Once it starts boiling, keep it boiling for 2 minutes. Then turn off heat.

steps.headline: Pour the beans into any sized bowl you would like to serve it in.
steps.description: Typically, this dish is serve in a black pot with a side of tea.

steps.headline: Add the chopped bell peppers and cilantro.
steps.description: Let these ingredients sit in the surface of the beans to give the dish a nice aesthetic look.

steps.headline: Warm up the pita bread and enjoy!
steps.description: The way most people eat this dish is by dipping the pita bread in and scooping up small amounts.
